title: Module 1: System Architecture - BIOS vs. UEFI
note: Explain the roles of BIOS and UEFI in hardware initialization, the POST process, and the transition to the bootloader.

title: The Linux Boot Sequence
note: Detail the boot sequence: Bootloader (GRUB2), Kernel and initramfs loading, and the handover to the init process (systemd).

title: GRUB2: Interactive Mode
note: Teach how to interact with the GRUB2 menu to select a kernel or edit boot parameters.

title: GRUB2: Permanent Configuration
note: Demonstrate modifying `/etc/default/grub` and using `update-grub` or `grub2-mkconfig`.

title: systemd: Targets and Runlevels
note: Introduce systemd targets. Teach how to view, switch, and set the default target using `systemctl`.

title: System Shutdown and Reboot Commands
note: Cover `shutdown`, `reboot`, `poweroff`, and `systemctl`.

title: Module 2: Linux Installation - Partitioning Schemes
note: Explain how to design a disk partitioning scheme, including separate partitions for `/`, `/home`, `/var`, and swap.

title: Partitioning with `fdisk` (MBR)
note: A step-by-step guide on how to use `fdisk` for MBR partitions.

title: Partitioning with `gdisk` (GPT)
note: A step-by-step guide on how to use `gdisk` for GPT partitions.

title: Creating Filesystems (`ext4`, `XFS`)
note: Teach how to format a partition with a filesystem using `mkfs.ext4` and `mkfs.xfs`.

title: Creating and Activating Swap Space
note: Show how to create a swap partition or a swap file using `mkswap` and activate it with `swapon`.

title: Module 3: Package Management - Shared Libraries
note: Explain shared libraries. Teach how to use `ldd` to identify required libraries and `ldconfig` to manage the library cache.

title: Debian: `dpkg`
note: Introduce the low-level Debian package manager, `dpkg`. Cover installing (`-i`), removing (`-r`), and querying (`-l`, `-s`) `.deb` packages.

title: Debian: `apt`
note: Teach the high-level APT toolkit. Cover `apt update`, `apt install`, `apt remove`, and `apt search` on Debian-based systems.

title: Red Hat: `rpm`
note: Introduce the low-level Red Hat Package Manager, `rpm`. Cover installing (`-i`), upgrading (`-U`), removing (`-e`), and querying (`-q`) `.rpm` packages.

title: Red Hat: `dnf` / `yum`
note: Teach the high-level `dnf` (or older `yum`) tool. Cover `dnf install`, `dnf remove`, `dnf search`, and managing repositories.

title: Module 4: GNU & Unix Commands - The Shell
note: Introduce the basics of the Bash shell, including command structure, using `history`, and leveraging tab completion.

title: Environment Variables
note: Explain environment variables. Cover viewing (`env`, `printenv`), setting (`export`), and unsetting variables. Discuss the `PATH` variable.

title: I/O Redirection and Pipes
note: Explain how to redirect standard input, output, and error using `>`, `>>`, `<`, `2>`, and the pipe operator `|`.

title: File Management Commands
note: Cover the essential file management commands: `ls`, `cp`, `mv`, `rm`, `mkdir`, `rmdir`, and `touch`.

title: Finding Files (`find`, `locate`)
note: Teach the `find` and `locate` commands to find files and directories.

title: Text Processing (`grep`, `sed`, `awk`)
note: Introduce the core text processing utilities: `grep` for searching, `sed` for stream editing, and `awk` for pattern scanning.

title: Archiving and Compressing
note: Teach how to create and extract archives using `tar` and compress them with `gzip`, `bzip2`, and `xz`.

title: The `vi`/`vim` Editor
note: Provide a survival guide to `vi`/`vim`, covering modes, navigation, editing, saving, and quitting.

title: Process Management
note: Teach how to monitor and control processes with `ps`, `top`, `kill`, `pgrep`, and `pkill`.

title: Module 5: Devices & Filesystems - FHS
note: Explain the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) and the purpose of key directories.

title: Mounting and Unmounting Filesystems
note: Teach how to use `mount` and `umount`. Explain the `/etc/fstab` file for persistent mounts.

title: Filesystem Integrity (`fsck`, `df`, `du`)
note: Teach how to check filesystem integrity with `fsck` and monitor disk space with `df` and `du`.

title: Permissions and Ownership
note: Detail the Linux permissions model. Teach `chmod`, `chown`, and `chgrp`.

title: Hard and Symbolic Links
note: Differentiate between hard and symbolic links and how to create them with `ln`.

title: Module 6: Shell Scripting & Automation - Bash Startup
note: Explain the role of startup files like `~/.bash_profile` and `~/.bashrc`.

title: Basic Scripting
note: Introduce the fundamentals of writing shell scripts: shebang, variables, quoting, and conditionals.

title: Scheduling Jobs with `cron`
note: Teach how to schedule recurring tasks using `cron` and the crontab format.

title: Module 7: Administration - User and Group Management
note: Cover `useradd`, `usermod`, `userdel`, `groupadd`, and the `/etc/passwd`, `/etc/shadow`, and `/etc/group` files.

title: System Time and NTP
note: Explain how to maintain system time and configure an NTP client.

title: System Logging (`rsyslog`, `journald`)
note: Introduce `rsyslog` and the systemd journal. Teach how to query the journal with `journalctl`.

title: Module 8: Networking - TCP/IP Fundamentals
note: Provide an overview of TCP/IP: IP addresses, netmasks, gateways, ports, and DNS.

title: Network Configuration
note: Teach how to view and configure network interfaces using `ip` and NetworkManager (`nmcli`).

title: Network Troubleshooting
note: Introduce essential tools like `ping`, `traceroute`, and `ss`.

title: DNS Client Configuration
note: Explain the role of `/etc/hosts`, `/etc/resolv.conf`, and `/etc/nsswitch.conf`.

title: Module 9: Security - Administration Tasks
note: Teach how to audit a system for SUID files, manage password aging with `chage`, and discover open ports with `nmap`.

title: Host Security and `sudo`
note: Cover basic host security hardening and how to configure `sudo` access via `visudo`.

title: Securing Data with SSH and GPG
note: Introduce SSH for secure remote access (including key-based authentication) and GPG for file encryption.

title: Module 10: Final Project - Web Server Setup
note: Outline the final project: automate the setup of a basic LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) web server using a shell script.

title: Final Project: Script Implementation
note: Guide the student through writing the shell script to install packages, enable services, and set basic security configurations.

title: Module 11: Further Reading
note: Provide links to key resources: the Bash manual, the LPI's official objective list, and popular community forums.
